content:
TableRowCollection Class

Definition

Encapsulates a collection of TableRow objects that represent a single row in a Table control. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.TableRowsCollectionEditor, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", typeof(System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor))]
public sealed class TableRowCollection : System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
System.Object
TableRowCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Use this class to programmatically manage a collection of TableRow objects. This class is commonly used to add or remove rows from a Table control.

Note

A Table control contains a Rows collection that represents a collection of TableRow objects. Each TableRow represents an individual row in the table and contains a Cells collection that represents a collection of TableCell objects. These TableCell objects represent the individual cells in the table. To get an individual cell, you must first get a TableRow from the Rows collection of a Table control. You can then get a TableCell from the Cells collection of the TableRow.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of TableRow objects in the TableRowCollection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of TableRow objects in the TableRowCollection. The default is 0.

Remarks

Use this property to determine the number of rows in the TableRowCollection. The Count property is often used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the TableRowCollection is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

false for all cases.

Remarks

This property always returns false to indicate that the TableRowCollection can be written to in all cases.

IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the TableRowCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).

public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
Value
Boolean

false for all cases.

Remarks

This property is derived from System.Collections.ICollection and is overridden to always return false.

For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the IsSynchronized property of the System.Collections.ICollection interface.

Item(Int32)

Gets a TableRow from the TableRowCollection at the specified index.

public System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

An ordinal index value that specifies which TableRow object to return. This index is zero-based.

Value
TableRow

A TableRow that represents an element in the TableRowCollection.

Remarks

Use this indexer to get an individual TableRow from the TableRowCollection at the specified index using simple array notation.

SyncRoot

Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the TableRowCollection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Remarks

The object returned in this implementation is the TableRowCollection itself.

For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the SyncRoot property of the System.Collections.ICollection interface.

Methods

Add(TableRow)

Appends the specified TableRow object to the end of the TableRowCollection.

public int Add (System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow row);
row
TableRow

The TableRow object to add to the TableRowCollection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the TableRow.

Remarks

Use this method to add a TableRow object to the end of a TableRowCollection.

AddAt(Int32,TableRow)

Adds the specified TableRow object to the TableRowCollection at the specified index location.

public void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow row);
index
Int32

The location in the TableRowCollection at which to add the TableRow.

row
TableRow

The TableRow object to add to the TableRowCollection.

Remarks

Use this method to insert the specified TableRow in a TableRowCollection at the specified index.

AddRange(TableRow[])

Appends the TableRow objects from the specified array to the end of the collection.

public void AddRange (System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow[] rows);
rows
TableRow[]

The array containing the TableRow objects to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the rows parameter is null.

Remarks

Use the AddRange method to append the TableRow objects from the specified array to the collection. This method is commonly used when you are constructing a table. To construct a table, first create an array of TableRow objects to represent the rows of the table. Next, use the AddRange method, passing the array as an argument, to add the TableRow objects to the collection.

Clear()

Removes all TableRow controls from the TableRowCollection.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

Use this method to remove all TableRow objects from the TableRowCollection and set the Count property to 0.

CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the items from the TableRowCollection to the specified Array, starting with the specified index in the Array.

public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

A zero-based Array that receives the copied items from the TableRowCollection.

index
Int32

The first position in the specified Array to receive copied contents.

Remarks

Use this method to copy the contents of the TableRowCollection into the specified System.Array, starting at the specified index.

Note

The array parameter must be a zero-based System.Array.

GetEnumerator()

Returns a IEnumerator implemented object that contains all TableRow objects within the TableRowCollection.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

A IEnumerator implemented object that contains all TableRow objects within the TableRowCollection.

Remarks

Use this method to create a System.Collections.IEnumerator implemented object that can be iterated through easily to get each item in the TableRowCollection.

Use the Current property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.

Use the MoveNext method to move to the next item in the collection.

Use the Reset method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.

Note

The MoveNext method must be called after creating a System.Collections.IEnumerator implemented object or using the Reset method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection. Otherwise, the item represented by the Current property is undefined.

GetRowIndex(TableRow)

Returns a value that represents the index of the specified TableRow from the TableRowCollection.

public int GetRowIndex (System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow row);
row
TableRow

The TableRow object to search for in the TableRowCollection.

Returns
Int32

The ordinal index position of the specified TableRow within the collection. The default is -1, which indicates that the specified TableRow has not been found.

Remarks

Use this method to determine the index of the specified TableRow in the TableRowCollection. If the specified TableRow is not found, an index of -1 is returned.

Remove(TableRow)

Removes the specified TableRow from the TableRowCollection.

public void Remove (System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow row);
row
TableRow

The TableRow object to remove from the TableRowCollection.

Remarks

Use this method to remove the specified TableRow from a TableRowCollection.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes a TableRow from the TableRowCollection at the specified index.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index of the TableRow object to remove from the TableRowCollection.

Remarks

Use this method to remove a TableRow from the TableRowCollection at the specified index.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IList.Add(Object)

Adds an object to the collection.

int IList.Add (object o);
o
System.Object

The object to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index at which the object was added to the collection.

Remarks

Typically, you should use the Add method to add an element to a TableRowCollection object.

The IList.Add method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.Contains(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is contained within the collection.

bool IList.Contains (object o);
o
System.Object

The object to locate within the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the object is in the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The IList.Contains method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.IndexOf(Object)

Searches for the specified object and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the collection.

int IList.IndexOf (object o);
o
System.Object

The object to locate within the collection.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the object within the collection; otherwise, -1 if the object is not in the collection.

Remarks

Typically, you should use the GetRowIndex method to get the index of an element in a TableRowCollection object.

The IList.IndexOf method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an object into the collection at the specified index.

void IList.Insert (int index, object o);
index
Int32

The zero-based index within the collection at which to insert the object.

o
System.Object

The object to insert into the collection.

Remarks

Typically, you should use the AddAt method to add an element to a TableRowCollection object.

The IList.Insert method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.IsFixedSize

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the list has a fixed size; otherwise, false

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to the IList interface.

IList.Item(Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Item*.

object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the element to get or set.

Returns
System.Object

The element at the specified index.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to the IList interface.

IList.Remove(Object)

Removes an object from the collection.

void IList.Remove (object o);
o
System.Object

The object to remove from the collection.

Remarks

Typically, you should use the Remove method to remove an element from a TableRowCollection object.

The IList.Remove method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the TableRowCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.
